poem:
**Unexpected Unions**

Flight attendants gather,
hands calloused from serving tiny bottles
and securing belts in midnight turbulence.
Voices, once softened by safety instructions,
now band together, grounded in a plea—
a turbulence of another sort,
an ask to halt, to hold.
Wings on a jacket, refusing to glide quietly by.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Seven major US labor unions call on Biden to ‘shut off military aid to Israel’ Seven major US labor unions representing about 6 million workers sent a letter to Joe Biden on Tuesday calling on his administration to “immediately halt all military aid to Israel” ahead of a visit to the US from Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s prime minister, this week. The unions that signed on to the letter include the Association of Flight Attendants (AFA),". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
